page.title: 07BRIDLEWAYS
page.content: Many people living in and visiting the Lower Wye Valley area enjoy horse- riding and the woodlands and river banks provide beautiful views for the riders.Bridleways are paths which were originally used for villagers to get to market.The bridleway from Brockweir to Bigsweir once extended to Monmouth. In 1830 it was moved nearer the river so that men and horses could pull barges up river.However in 1950 new maps showed the bridleway as a footpath by mistake .When people wanted to ride on the path a farmer called Mr.Williams tried to stop them. It was left to a judge in the Crown Court to decide that it was a bridle- way,it was moved to its original posi- tion and the path by the river used as a footpath.Horse riders have to take care not to use any footpaths in the area,barriers are built to stop them.
